properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 8 at 3:15PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
After above average warmth this weekend, significant changes to
the weather pattern will unfold Sunday night into Monday and
Tuesday. A cold front will quickly invade northeastern New Mexico
Sunday, advancing farther south and west into the state Sunday
night. In addition to the colder temperatures and gusty winds,
precipitation is also expected to develop Sunday night across much
of central New Mexico. Precipitation in the form of rain and high
elevation snow will continue Monday while expanding farther west
through the day.

While snow accumulations will generally be light through Monday,
another cold front will begin surging into New Mexico Monday night
and Tuesday, helping snow to expand and intensify. Lower elevation
areas can expect light to moderate snowfall accumulations while
higher mountain areas have the potential to pick upwards of a foot
or more through Tuesday. The second surge of colder temperatures
will also send daytime temperatures 10 to 25 degrees below mid-
February averages with harsh wind chills.

Anyone planning travel in New Mexico Sunday night through Tuesday
should be prepared for potential adverse weather conditions with
strong winds, snow-covered roads, and low visibility. Monitor NOAA
weather radio, weather.gov/abq or your local media for the latest
weather updates. For the latest New Mexico road conditions visit
nmroads.com or call 5-1-1.

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER CHANGES EXPECTED LATE SUNDAY INTO MONDAY AND TUESDAY
